question: werden
english: to become, will, to be done (passive voice)

question: machen
english: to make, to prepare (e.g. food), to do
french: faire, préparer (par exemple de la nourriture)

question: tun
english: to do, to do something to someone
french: faire, faire quelque chose à quelqu'un

question: gehen
english: to go, to leave, to work, to function (coll.)

question: kommen
english: to come, to make it (e.g. over something), to go to, to occur

question: bringen
english: to bring, to take, to lead

question: stehen
english: to stand, to be, to appear

question: nehmen
english: to take, to cause oneself to be (in some state)

question: bekommen
english: to receive, to catch (e.g. a cold), to sit well with someone
french: recevoir, attraper (par exemple un rhume), s'entendre avec quelqu'un

question: vergessen
english: to forget, to leave (forget to take)

question: halten
english: to hold, to stop (a movement), to support, to keep

question: warten
english: to wait, to maintain (e.g. a car)

question: kennen
english: to know, to be acquainted with, to be familiar with

question: verstehen
english: to understand, to get along with someone

question: fahren
english: to go (by vehicle), to leave, to drive

question: treffen
english: to meet (refl.), to encounter (refl.), to hit, to affect

question: lernen
english: to learn, to study, to train something
french: apprendre, étudier, se former à quelque chose

question: zeigen
english: to show, to point at, to demonstrate

question: laufen
english: to walk, to flow (of a fluid), to run (of an event)
french: marcher, couler (un fluide), se dérouler (un événement)

question: erklären
english: to explain, to declare, to assert

question: zahlen
english: to pay (for something), to atone for

question: kochen
english: to cook, to boil (to heat a liquid), to boil something
french: cuire, faire bouillir (chauffer un liquide), faire bouillir quelque chose

question: aufstehen
english: to get up, to be open (e.g. a window, door)
french: se lever, être ouvert (par exemple une fenêtre, une porte)

question: wohnen
english: to live, to reside, to dwell

question: anziehen
english: to get dressed, to put on, to dress someone, to attract, to pull
french: s'habiller, mettre, habiller quelqu'un, attirer, tirer

question: ausziehen
english: to take something off, to undress, to pull out, to move out
french: enlever quelque chose, se déshabiller, se retirer, sortir

question: ziehen
english: to pull, to drag, to move

question: anrufen
english: to call by telephone, to call on (someone)

question: aufhören
english: to stop, to cease an activity or process
french: arrêter, cesser une activité ou un processus

question: beginnen
english: to begin (on a certain date or time)
french: commencer (à une certaine date ou heure)

question: aufmachen
english: to open (coll.), to head or move off (refl.), to undo something
french: ouvrir (familier), se diriger ou s'éloigner (réfl.), défaire quelque chose

question: sitzen
english: to be seated, to stay, to fit (of clothing)

question: stellen
english: to position, to put, to catch

question: legen
english: to lay, to lean, to lie down

question: freuen
english: to make glad, to be glad (refl.), to look forward (refl.)
french: rendre heureux, être heureux (réfl.), attendre avec impatience (réfl.)

question: schließen
english: to shut, to close, to lock, to conclude

question: einladen
english: to invite, to load (something into a container)
french: inviter, charger (quelque chose dans un conteneur)

question: tragen
english: to wear (clothing), to carry, to hold

question: ansehen
english: to look at something, to watch something
french: regarder quelque chose, observer quelque chose

question: probieren
english: to try, to taste, to sample, to probe

question: wählen
english: to choose, to dial (a number), to vote

question: ausgehen
english: to go out, to run out (e.g. of money)
french: sortir, être à court (par exemple d'argent)

question: ankommen
english: to arrive, to depend on something

question: kennenlernen
english: to meet someone, to get to know someone
french: rencontrer quelqu'un, apprendre à connaître quelqu'un

question: anmelden
english: to register, to sign up, to sign on

question: lassen
english: to let, to leave, to allow

question: verlassen
english: to leave, to trust with something (refl.), to pass away, to die
french: partir, confier quelque chose (réfl.), décéder, mourir

question: versprechen
english: to promise, to hope for, to misspeak

question: hängen
english: to hang, to be fond of, depend on

question: verheiraten
english: to marry (to perform the marriage), to get married (refl.)
french: se marier (célébrer le mariage), se marier (réfl.)

question: fehlen
english: to lack, to be absent or missing

question: vorstellen
english: to introduce, to present oneself (refl.), to move forward, to represent

question: vermissen
french: se manquer quelque chose ou quelqu'un

question: teilen
english: to split, to share, to divide

question: unterschreiben
english: to sign, to subscribe, to unterwrite

question: stimmen
english: to be true, to vote, to tune
